column4: and linux was supposed to be easy ;) whats the issue with HDMI audio=
is there a white plug there too with the red and yellow?
can you use the VGA input on your TV?
there might be
but its not a 'standard' audio connector
yes the vga works, but crappy resolution
exactly, i need at least 720p =)
VGA won't do 1280X720 on your tv?
nope
how about dvi?
havent thought of that, I do have a dvi-vga swich actually (since the tv only has a vga connector)
as long as your computer has the analog version of DVI available..

yeah but most do? anyway it would be so much easier with hdmi, ive recently bought a cable just for this. and now I need to get a long vga and audio cable. (since the computer is built into a 'wall' some meters away
if you use the vga port in the TV, there are probably audio inputs very close to it to use
it's only easier with hdmi if your computer's hdmi will do it properly
i mean, if it can't do what you want how you want, it will be MUCH harder (impossible) to make it do what you want
well the computer is doing it properly. not ubuntu though. no audio is getting through. and I havent found any way to fix it, not even someone stating they know how to
are you sure audio is coming out the signal?
I see. well mthen ill figure out some nice solution.
i shuold double check that, ill get something that i know can receive hdmi sound properly and test
ssh is the client, sshd is the server
oh so sshd isnt installed with the ssh package?
probably not
